Tiber AI Community

Flan-UL2

Transformer 4K context Instruction TGI Google Translation

Google's Flan-UL2 model running on Text Generation Inference (TGI) on Intel XPU. Flan-UL2 excels at instruction-following tasks like translation, summarization, and question answering.

‚ö†Ô∏è Before using this model, please review the license terms and usage rights on the Hugging Face model page. Ensure your use case complies with the model's terms of use and check for any commercial usage restrictions.

üìä Model Specs

  • Model ID: google/flan-ul2
  • Context Window: 4096 tokens
  • Hardware: Intel Data Center GPU Max Series

üí™ Strengths

  • Instruction following
  • Translation tasks
  • Text summarization
  • Structured responses

üéØ Use Cases

  • Language translation
  • Text summarization
  • Question answering
  • Classification tasks

Security & Performance Features

üîí Token-based authentication with automatic ban after failed attempts
üö¶ Rate limiting (global: 10 req/s, per-IP: 10 req/s)
üõ°Ô∏è Security headers and IP protection
üîÑ Health monitoring and automatic recovery
üöÄ Optimized for Intel GPUs

Quick Start Guide

Get up and running in minutes

1

Create Account

Create a standard account on Intel Tiber AI Cloud

Visit Intel Cloud Portal ‚Üí
2

Select Hardware

Select an Intel Data Center Max Series GPU VM

3

Clone Repository

Clone the TGI repository

git clone https://github.com/tiberaicommunity/xpu_tgi
4

Generate Token

Generate authentication token for secure access

python utils/generate_token.py
5

Start Model

Start the FLAN-UL2 model

./start.sh flan-ul2
6

Test Model

Make a test request to verify deployment

curl -X POST http://localhost:8083/generate \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"inputs": "Summarize this text: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.", "parameters": {"max_new_tokens": 50}}'
